name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

name: In the footsteps of the Tiger of Mysore.
description: Discover the history of Bangalore fort, its tales of glory & treachery over the past five centuries with us.The walk begins with a vegetarian breakfast. After that we take our guests to explore the remnants of Tipu's summer palace, the Bangalore fort & the armory.During the course of the walk learn how Anglo-French wars in Europe & North America had their impact in Southern India too.The guests get to learn more about Tipu's weapons on mass destruction of the 18th century & how they influenced the US national anthem & how one small Southern Indian kingdom was a thorn in the East India Company's rule.

location.address: XH5F+PFR, Tippu Sultan Palace Rd, Chamrajpet, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560018, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm

name: Dialogues with Books: A Mystery Awaits
description: Dialogues with Books Monthly Meetup: A Mystery AwaitsThis month, DWB is diving into the shadows for a genre-specific gathering that’s all about Mystery!Whether you're into classic whodunits, psychological thrillers, cozy mysteries, or gritty noir, we’re shining the spotlight on all things enigmatic. From iconic authors like Conan Doyle, Agatha Christie and Raymond Chandler to modern masters like Tana French, Jane Harper and Gillian Flynn- this meetup is for the curious, the clue-hunters, and the plot-twist lovers.Bring your favourite mystery book, a recommendation, or just your sleuthing spirit. Let’s crack open some secrets together. 🔎What is Dialogues with Books: DWB is one of Bangalore's much loved book communities. With a thriving online community and engaging monthly meetups/events, we have over the years carefully created a close knit group of bibliophiles and enthusiastic readers.We meet up regularly on the third Sunday of every month.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Sunday Breakfast with Strangers
description: Make Your Sunday Shine with New Connections!✨There’s something magical about a slow Sunday morning—the clink of coffee cups, sunlight on the table, and the comfort of good company.Sunday Breakfast with Strangers is your invitation to pause, share a meal, and connect with people you’ve never met—yet.Whether you’re here for that first sip of strong coffee, a plate of something warm, or just a moment of genuine conversation, this table is about beginning the day with open minds and unexpected friendships.Come as you are. Leave with more than just a full plate. 🌟

Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: Coffee & Conversations: The Traveller's Table
description: Hey, fellow wanderer! Got a travel tale to tell?Welcome to the Travel Tales Table, where no luggage is required😜Whether you have travelled the entire world or just starting to explore one destination at a time, this table is for you.﻿Come join us for a table filled with travel stories this weekend; share your travel experiences and meet fellow travel enthusiasts over a cup of coffee.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Girl Talk Chronicles: Keeping Up with Perfection
description: *Only for Women* 🌸This table is a space for women to get honest about the pressure to “have it all together.”From picture-perfect Pinterest moms to flawlessly filtered Instagram lives, today’s digital world bombards us with impossible standards. Whether it’s parenting, career, beauty, or home life, we’re constantly fed the idea that we should be doing more—and doing it better.Together, we’ll explore how these fake ideals affect our confidence, mental health, and sense of self-worth. Most importantly, we’ll talk about how to break free from the perfection trap and embrace the beauty of being real.

name: Leela by Sanjay Divecha (Live) at Sabha BLR
description: Sanjay Divecha is one of the most revered guitar players in India. A unique and compelling voice as a player and composer, he is part of the hugely successful supergroup Cross Currents led by Zakir Hussain and featuring stalwarts such as Dave Holland, Vinnie Colaiuta, Chris Potter, Eddie Daniels, Shankar Mahadevan and Louiz Banks. Through a luminous 35 year long career, Sanjay has worked with artists such as Angelique Kidjo, Carlos Santana, Michael McDonald, Fred Raulston, Dave Weckl, Louis Johnson, Dumazz and Sambaguru among others.He also collaborated with A.R. Rahman on the Danny Boyle movie “127 Hours” that won ‘Best Original Score’, the OST for the movie “Woman on Top” with Argentinian composer Luis Bacalov, Sanjay also scored for the movie ‘Leela’ by Somnath Sen which won a Special Jury Award at Toronto Reel World Film Festival.An alumnus (1989) from Musician’s Institute (M.I) in Los Angeles, Sanjay continues to mentor and develop musicians all over the country. His students are not only guitar players, but composers, musicians and singers of all disciplines. Sanjay teaches private lessons and holds workshops to develop musicality and a well rounded aesthetic sensibility in musicians. Sanjay Divecha on the music of 'Leela' :" As a human being on this planet I’ve always believed in the Oneness of all things in this universe. Going through life's bylanes and observing how events unfold and teach you the lessons to be learned, this belief of Oneness has only strengthened with time. My work as an artist has primarily been to connect with my inner self, and express from a place of honesty. The yearning to learn something new in my art and refine my skill set has been my constant companion. After having written and performed music with various ensembles, I finally mustered up the courage to record a collection of music which was mainly written for solo guitar, and also mainly recorded on acoustic guitar. These songs are reflections of some of my journeys and inspirations, interpreted in a spontaneous and instinctive manner. The title 'Leela' refers to the divine Leela - joyous and playful - yet a profound act of creation. As I started the recording process I started to add a few layers to enhance the music and some guest artists came on board to complete the experience which was truly fulfilling for me as an artist. The organic nature of this work takes me back to my formative years as a guitar player and I’m grateful to be sharing this work and for it to take its own journey. "SEATING ON FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS

name: The Kind Coffee Party ; A White Chapter
description: Start your Saturday morning on a high note at The Kind Coffee Party — a white-themed experience where caffeine meets music.Be part of an exclusive experience where a community comes together for a high-energy morning party with signature brews, flavourful food from The Kind kitchen, groovy music to keep you moving and inspiring conversations. Whether you're coming solo or with your crew, this is your sign to trade your usual morning for something a little more electric.An alcohol-free, caffeine-fueled celebration designed to connect, uplift, and empower in a vibrant space.It’s a celebration of everything we love, great coffee & food, good music, and even better company.Date: 28 June 2025, SaturdayTime: 9.30 AM – 12 PMLocation: The Kind at The Bay, Ecoworld, BellandurDress Code: All White

name: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru ft.Mahaa@Pebble|29th June
description: This evening is all about celebration and coming together as an inclusive community supporting a worldwide conscious movement where we will arrive at a safer space to let go, feel free, connect with our authentic selves and move to the organic beats of our body with, ECSTATIC DANCE BENGALURUDance for WellnessYour monthly doze of Dance Medicine. (Every last Sunday of the month) 📅 29th June 2025 | Sunday ⏳ 5pm - 7pm 📍Pebble - The Jungle Lounge ★ TIMELINE4.30pm: Doors open 4.45pm: Check in / warm up music 5.00pm: : Opening circle / intro 5.15pm: Ecstatic Dance set 6.45pm: Closing / sharing circle 7.00pm : Hugs & Hangout (Doors close at 5.15pm. Kindly arrive on time.) ★ ABOUT: Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru is a regular conscious dance chapter with monthly free flow sessions, powered by Ecstatic World, pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020. From the makers of Odessa Amsterdam, the most popular conscious dance hub in Amsterdam, they create transformational experiences with Ecstatic Dance as dance for wellness for all. 👣 Dance for your well being 👣 Dance for your mental health👣 Dance as a self love ritual 👣 Dance for all 👣 Dance for freedom 👣 Dance for change 👣 Dance to life With Ecstatic Dance, we will connect with the self and others, enjoy moments of bliss and freedom, allowing the music to take us on a musical journey following a few basic guidelines. ★ ECSTATIC DANCE GUIDELINESIn ecstatic dance, We are without 🙅🏾👣 Footwear, to be grounded 🍺 Intoxicants, to be clear 🤐 Talking, to be embodied 📷 Mobile phones / camera, to be fully present Ft. ★ MAHAAMahaa aka Mahalakshmi is all about creating magic on the dancefloor with her effortless mixes from Organic, progressive House to tribal beats, world rhythms and medicine music.  Her sets are an invitation to take you on a journey of emotional release and soulful connection. She blends genres in a way that’s both uplifting and transformative. Her soundscapes are designed to move your soul and touch your spirit.Mahaa is our homegrown talent at Ecstatic World, and we are happy to have her as our resident musical guide with Ecstatic Dance Bengaluru.★ ADDITIONAL INFO- We maintain our personal boundaries with the namaste sign. - Respect the space and one another.- Move however you wish. - If you are coming with a child, kindly tend to them wholeheartedly so as to maintain the quietness of the space during the opening and closing circle. - Dress comfortable. -Kindly take care of personal hygiene before joining the session. -Avoid wearing strong smelling perfumes / synthetic fragrances.-Maximum capacity 100 per session. - Please kindly note that upon purchasing a ticket, ED Bengaluru team and management are not liable for any injury that may incur at the session. That you agree to take full responsibility of yourself, your child’s safety and all of your belongings. ★ DRESS CODE   The fit you shine best in. ★ TICKET PRICE1500 INR (incl. taxes), via Urbanaut 2000 INR (incl.taxes), at the door Student ticket available at 50 % discount (at the door)  ▪Mandatory to produce a valid student ID card at check in.▪no cash, only gpay !★ CONNECTTag us on your IG stories and posts to let us know you are coming. Help us spread the awareness of this conscious dance practice in your own creative way and get a chance to win a free ticket for our upcoming sessions. IG : @ecstaticdancebengaluruFB : Ecstatic World  WhatsApp: ‪+91 93247 65794‬Email: ecstaticdanceworld@gmail.com ★ VENUE Pebble - The Jungle Lounge,Palace Grounds 3, Bellary Road,     Bengaluru-560080 ★ DESIGN  Elevantis Studio★ JOIN THE CONSCIOUS GLOBAL DANCE MOVEMENT HAPPENING IN ALL MAJOR CITIES/ COUNTRIES AROUND WORLD...🌻 #befreebeyou 👣 #ecstaticdancebengaluru 🇮🇳 #ecstaticdanceindia ♥ #danceforwellness🏳‍🌈 #inclusivity🌏 #globalcommunity🙏🏾 #safespace

location.address: Gate number 9, Princess Academy, Palace Grounds 3 , Ramana Maharishi Road, Bellary Rd, Jayamahal, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560080, India

organizer.name: Ecstatic World
organizer.description: Pioneering Ecstatic Dance in India since 2020, ECSTATIC WORLD is a conscious events company creating transformational experiences. The logo of Ecstatic World is an Egyptian sign symbolizing, 'Transformation of the self'.

name: Creative Writing Workshop
description: This is a personalized, one-on-one writing workshop designed for those who want to reconnect with their writing in a focused, supportive space. The workshop is structured in three parts:Part 1: Prompt-Based Self-Reflection: We`ll begin with a guided reflection exercise using carefully chosen prompts. This part helps you explore personal thoughts, emotions, and experiences through writing—an excellent practice for journaling, memoir, or emotional clarity.Part 2: Creative Fiction Exercise: In the second half, you`ll be given an on-the-spot creative writing prompt to develop a short fictional piece. This encourages spontaneity, imagination, and narrative flow.Part 3: Understanding Yourself Better Using The 2 Writing ExercisesWe conclude by collecting our thoughts and discussing what you have learnt about yourself and about each other through our pieces in the workshop. You can write in any language you`re comfortable with. This format allows for flexible pacing, open conversation, and tailored feedback (if desired).Whether you`re looking to jumpstart your writing practice, process personal experiences, or simply enjoy a quiet hours of creativity, this one-on-one session is designed to meet you where you are—no pressure, just honest expression and guided structure.About the host : Swathi is a Berlin based writer who writes short fiction in different genres. She conducts creative writing workshops that help people process various emotions through self reflection pieces and overcome writer’s block by building a fictional world in a limited time. You can follow her on Instagram @swathispeaks or read her work on Medium.

description: This is a personalized, one-on-one writing workshop designed for those who want to reconnect with their writing in a focused, supportive space. The workshop is structured in three parts:Part 1: Prompt-Based Self-Reflection: We`ll begin with a guided reflection exercise using carefully chosen prompts. This part helps you explore personal thoughts, emotions, and experiences through writing—an excellent practice for journaling, memoir, or emotional clarity.Part 2: Creative Fiction Exercise: In the second half, you`ll be given an on-the-spot creative writing prompt to develop a short fictional piece. This encourages spontaneity, imagination, and narrative flow.Part 3: Understanding Yourself Better Using The 2 Writing ExercisesWe conclude by collecting our thoughts and discussing what you have learnt about yourself and about each other through our pieces in the workshop. You can write in any language you`re comfortable with. This format allows for flexible pacing, open conversation, and tailored feedback (if desired).Whether you`re looking to jumpstart your writing practice, process personal experiences, or simply enjoy a quiet hours of creativity, this one-on-one session is designed to meet you where you are—no pressure, just honest expression and guided structure.About the host : Swathi is a Berlin based writer who writes short fiction in different genres. She conducts creative writing workshops that help people process various emotions through self reflection pieces and overcome writer’s block by building a fictional world in a limited time. You can follow her on Instagram @swathispeaks or read her work on Medium.

name: Hello, “Thirsty Crow”! - at Sabha, BLR
description: Hello, Thirsty Crow!Puppet Show, Art Session and some Fun-Time! For Children aged 2-6 Years (and anyone who loves puppetry) 📍 Venue: Sabha, Kamaraj Road, Shivajinagar, BLR📅 Date: Sunday, July 13th, 2025⏰ Time: 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM🎟️ Tickets — pre-registration is a must!About The SessionWatch a modern take on the classic Panchatantra Story, “The Thirsty Crow” – with a handmade puppet! In a mini-theatrical setting, the imagination goes on a ride with songs, edutainment and a moral for a lifetime! Discover the magic of puppet-making as you dive into the creative process and learn how to bring your puppet to life!Meet The PuppeteerArt. Story. Repeat!Seeming like a traditional Virtual Reality (VR), Aditi is amused by this loop - Art creates a character and the Story is your imagination - endless possibilities!Starting her career as a UX/UI/Graphic Design IT professional in Bengaluru, she now pursues her childhood passion of bead art and puppetry - band of beads.About The VenueSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.

description: :🌊 Breathe. Release. Reconnect. ❄️Step into a transformative journey with our Breathwork & Ice Bath Workshop—a space designed for deep healing, inner strength, and true self-discovery.Imagine immersing yourself in powerful breathwork, unlocking emotions stored within, and letting go of what no longer serves you. Feel your body awaken as you step into the ice bath, learning to embrace discomfort and build resilience from within.This experience is for you if you want to:✨ Release stress & emotional blockages✨ Enhance focus & mental clarity✨ Boost your energy & immune system✨ Cultivate a deeper mind-body connection📍 Venue: Indiranagar, Bangalore📅 Date & Time: June 28, 2025 | 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM📞 Call/WhatsApp: +91-9814418510🔗 Instagram: @the_sacred_cocoonCome as you are—leave feeling empowered, lighter, and more connected to yourself than ever before. Limited spots available! 🌿💙

name: Wiggleroom Popups (Series 2) : Analog Jam
description: Calling all synth lovers! Whether you're rolling with vintage hardware, fancy digital rigs, DAWs or Eurorack—it’s time to bring your gear and groove together. Join our Synth Petting Zoo + Jam: a laid-back meetup to swap patches, sync up your clocks (MIDI/CV), and improvise with a crew that speaks your sound language.We’ll start with a casual intro—share your setup and the sonic mood you’re tuning in from—then jump into free-flowing jams. Bring your own cables and let’s respect each other’s space: leave room in the frequency spectrum, watch your volume, and follow simple non‑verbal cues like nods or hand raises to shift the vibe. Our goal? No solo shows—just collective music, curious experimentation, and good conversation

name: Alkmy - Malt & Meat
description: Our next pop-up is six-course tribute to old Bangalore’s naati cuisine -curated by Chef Kalyan, paired with Indian single malts by Paul John. This is a slow-cooked telling of a city’s past, where Tamil, Maratha, and Andhra influences simmer together in Old Bangalore’s ‘pete’ neighbourhoods to create something rich, fiery, and unforgettable.MENU:SALTBannur Lamb RibletsSalt cured Bannur lamb riblets confit cooked, paired with Paul John NirvanaPEPPERBannur Lamb OrgansLiver, heart, kidney & spleen of Bannur lamb sautéed with freshly ground black pepper, paired with Paul John MadeiraKOTHMIRIBannur Lamb ShoulderTender chunks of Bannur lamb shoulder sautéed in different forms of heirloom coriander, paired with Paul John PortGREEN CHILLIChilli Bannur Mutton, Akki RotiTender chunks of Bannur lamb leg, slow cooked with locally grown green chilliesRED CHILLIBannur Mutton Chops Fry, Mini DosaFatty & tender Bannur lamb chops slow cooked with a blend of homemade spices, paired with Paul John BrillianceMINTBannur Mutton Palav, RaithaExotic Old Bangalore style palav cooked with mint-based masala & coconut milkJAGGERYPheniOld Bangalore’s favourite dessert served traditionally, paired with Paul John Pedro Ximénez﻿Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Girl Dinner Bangalore
description: Not just dinner. An intimate and luxurious experience.We’re hosting a cozy, intimate gathering for women who are tired of surface-level small talk and craving real connection. This isn’t a big event—it’s intentionally small, so every guest feels seen. You’ll be paired with someone special at the table to help you ease into conversation, share stories, and maybe even spark a new friendship. Whether you come alone or with a friend, you’ll leave feeling full—of food, laughter, and love.Limited seats.

name: Madhuragati: An Odissi Dance Performance
description: Madhuragati - Every step in Odissi resounds with the sweetness of a cultural aesthetic formed over centuries of aspiration for a higher goal.. To celebrate the beauty of this exquisite dance form arising from the life and beliefs of the people of forgone times till now. Anoushka will perform dance works that showcase a range of possibilities highlighting the sculptural and expressive qualities of the Odissi style.The performance features five pieces, seamlessly connected by brief introductory interludes. This carefully crafted format offers an engaging experience for the audience, guiding them through the beauty of the Odissi classical dance form. Originally a sacred ritual dedicated to the gods, Odissi is one of the oldest dance traditions in the world. Odissi speaks of love and union, between the human and divine, transporting viewers to enchanted worlds of magic and spirituality. Its sensuous and lyrical grace reflects both the motifs of Odisha temple sculpture as well as the poetry from the deep wellsprings of Odia music.Anoushka Rahman, disciple of Guru Surupa Sen, is the new soloist and emerging star of The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.She started her Odissi journey with Smt.Dona Ganguly in Kolkata and holds a Sangeet Bhaskar in Odissi dance and a postgraduate degree in Mathematics.Her association with Nrityagram began in 2018 through a Summer Workshop, which paved the way for advanced training under the guidance of Surupa Sen and Pavithra Reddy. Recognised for her talent and dedication, she was awarded the Virendra Kumar Laroia Fellowship. She has performed with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble across India, the US, Canada and Sri Lanka and was presented in a solo debut performance in November 2024. At present, Anoushka is a dancer with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.ChoreographyGuru Kelucharan Mohapatra (Sun Maiyyā)Surupa SenMusic CompositionPt. Raghunath PanigrahiPt. Bhubaneswar Mishra (Sakhī Hé)Ashit Desai (Sun Maiyyā)Technical Director & Lighting DesignerLynne FernandezNrityagramwww.nrityagram.orglynne@nrityagram.orgVenue: SABHA Blr, 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Next Chapter- Succession, Rights & Legal Clarity
description: This session is designed for those seeking legal clarity around personal rights, succession planning, and legacy—without the stress of one-on-one consultations or complicated legalese.Led by a senior advocate and legal expert, the experience will gently walk you through key questions many of us avoid:– What happens if there is no will? – How are assets typically inherited or contested? – What’s the difference between nomination and succession? – What kind of paperwork is good to have in place, and why?We often spend decades building lives, families, and futures—but rarely pause to understand the systems that hold it all. This session creates space for that pause.You won’t be asked to share personal details. This is not a therapy or legal advice session. It is a practical, high-level walkthrough to help you feel more informed and in control.Come if you're ready to: – Get your legal basics in place – Understand succession planning with more ease – Feel more confident about your next stepsThis is part of Zuva Life’s wider effort to support individuals in navigating transitions—gently, wisely, and with good information.

name: Ladies Lounge Brunch Bangalore
description: THIS IS A SAPPHIC/FEMME/WOMEN ONLY EVENT Ladies Lounge is a brunch event for sapphic individuals to meet and network in a safe environment. The event embraces women and sapphic non-binary individuals (21+) from diverse backgrounds and sexual orientations. You can come to chill and connect with others who share similar interests, bodies and pleasure.What we expect from you:- You follow the rules of consent - You are respectful to people across all genders, sexualities and lifestyle choices- Dress to express femininity Vetting and Payments:-Only those who pass the vetting calls will be allowed to attend our events- If you bring a friend you will get 10% off ticket price. The more friends the more discounts -Once you pass the the vetting call you will be offered a TIC Events membership which if you choose to take, will grant you a discount of 25 % off on all future online and offline events for the next 12 months-If you choose to not take the membership, you can pay the ticket amount and confirm your slot to the event-If you fail the vetting process you will need to take our sex and gender masterclass and pass a written test to gain the membership and attend the eventWe are doing this to ensure that the spaces TIC creates are completely safe for everyone. We also get a lot of responses from people for our events and end up spending a good amount of time vetting people who may or may not attend the event if they pass the vetting. The above process makes sure that we are compensated for our time and that you are serious about attending the event.

organizer.name: The Intimacy Curator
organizer.description: We are an organisation promoting self-discovery through emotional and physical wellbeing. We offer dating, intimacy and relationship coaching services to curious individuals, couples and polycules of all sexual and romantic orientations, abilities and and gender identities.

name: Voice Activation : Women's Circle
description: There are moments in life when our voice feels distant—buried under fear, pressure, or the need to keep the peace.This circle is a space to return to your voice—not just the one you speak with, but the one that lives deep in your body.We’ll begin with a warm, heart-opening cup of ceremonial cacao, sipped slowly with intention. From there, we’ll move gently through guided journaling, sharing in circle, and voice activation work.⸻What is Voice Activation?Voice activation is not about speaking eloquently or loudly.It’s about tuning into the parts of your voice that have gone quiet—due to conditioning, trauma, or simply the pace of life.Through guided breathwork, gentle movement, and somatic sound-making (like sighs, hums, and tonal release), we’ll explore the voice as sensation, not performance. This practice helps you feel more grounded, more connected, and more free to express yourself honestly.Our voice is deeply connected to our nervous system, womb space, and inner truth—this is a space to remember that connection.⸻Who this is for?This circle is for anyone identifying as a woman who has ever felt:•	Like their voice is too much—or not enough•	Silenced, unsure, or disconnected from what they want•	Ready to reclaim a sense of self-expression, softness, and inner clarityNo prior experience with voice, sound, or circles is needed—just a willingness to show up, as you are.About the therapistSanjana is a therapist and facilitator passionate about reconnecting women with their bodies, cycles, and ancestral wisdom. She holds an academic degree in psychology and a yoga teacher training certification, equipping her to facilitate sacred circles and teach about menstruality and women’s bodies.Her work blends psychology, somatics, and community healing to help women honour their natural rhythms. She believes true empowerment comes from embracing our bodies and rewriting the stories we've been told about femininity. Rooted in her own journey of healing, she creates spaces for women to feel seen, held, and deeply connected.About the SpaceThe Studio by Copper + Cloves is a plant-based Studio and Cafe - a beautiful sunlit space where we hold space for wellness and connection. We will be providing nourishing, wholesome refreshments as part of this experience.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Papabear - Live
description: Step into an evening of heartfelt songwriting and genre-blending soundscapes with Papabear, the moniker of Mumbai-based singer-songwriter and producer Samarth Bahl. Known for his evocative lyrics and warm, immersive performances, Papabear crafts a musical experience that feels both intimate and expansive. Drawing from hip-hop, alt pop, and lo-fi influences, his live set promises a journey through emotion and groove—whether in a stripped-down solo format or with a vibrant band. Having toured the country with the acclaimed band Smalltalk and graced stages at NH7, VH1 Supersonic, and Ziro Festival, Papabear now brings his unique artistry to Ram’s Musique Experience. Join us for a night of new sounds, including songs from his recent release "Love, me" and a preview of his upcoming Hindi single "Lamhe," as he builds towards his debut album, Raw Honey.

location.address: 28, 1st Floor, Public Utility Building, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.description: India's largest vinyl record store and experience centre

name: To Move Abroad or Not? By Nupur & Zero1 Network
description: Thinking of moving abroad? Is it still worth it?This interactive session is designed for anyone on the fence about taking the leap—or returning after years away.Join Nupur Dave, ex-Google TPM, author, and founder of NRI Compass, as she breaks down the real talk behind global moves: the trade-offs, emotional baggage, career moves, and financial logistics. Nupur has helped 1000's of NRIs make the decision to move back to India— now watch her give you a perspective you've never seen before.With audience polls, lived stories, and practical frameworks this talk will help you make one of life’s biggest decisions. You get coffee and refreshments too!This is for you ifYou're between 25-50 yrs ageYou're contemplating a move either actively or passivelyVenue Partner: Wework IndiaBacked by: Zero1 Network https://zero1byzerodha.com/network

location.address: Wework Galaxy, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: NRI Compass
organizer.description: Nupur has been helping NRIs and Indians make decisions on where to live and how to create a better life for themselves.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Doggy's Day Out; A Tail-Wagging Brunch for a Cause
description: Doggy's Day Out is a collaboration between Xanadu Kitchen and Heads Up for Tails to raise money for neighbourhood streeties.This fun brunch includes : Free Pet Meals (courtesy HUFT), Street Food for Hoomans (Available for Purchase), Fun games and activities for dogsPeople without dogs are also welcome to the event.

name: A Tipsy Y2K Movie Night with Boo! Ya Watchin?
description: Starring Mira Sorvino and Lisa Kudrow, Romy and Michele’s High School Reunion is a comedic alternative to Thelma & Louise and a wonderfully lighthearted balm for anyone with traumatic high school memories.Come in your Y2K finest (think chunky heels, checkered pants, funky jewellery), sip on curated cocktails inspired by the movie, munch on some delicious snacks, and enjoy a laid-back screening of this late 90s classic. Designed to feel like a night in with your favourite people. Ladies Who Loiter  is a multi-city celebration inspired by leisure, love and art. Carefully curated by some incredible women, this is our little love letter to ladies everywhere to add more leisure, lightness, play and art into their lives. This monsoon edition bring cozy hangs and welcoming corners to keep leisure alive, come rain or shine. Boo! Ya Watchin?, the brainchild of Mahima. V is a Bangalore-based film screening series that turns cult classics and hidden gems into shared, immersive experiences.At Urbanaut, we're building unique and niche experiences in collaboration with our ever-present partners. Invite yourself to one — or three — or hit us up with ideas and collaborations!

location.address: Plot 37, 80 Feet Rd, Hal, HAL 3rd Stage, New Tippasandra, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560075, India

name: Weekend Under the Stars – Geodesic Dome Getaway
description: Stay inside a luxury geodesic dome, soak in a jacuzzi, meet like-minded strangers, and vibe under the stars.This is for people who love nature, want to take a break from the hustle and bustle of city life, and just slow down... If stargazing, great conversations, and being in the middle of nature sound like your vibe — this is for you.Travel Trip Tourist brings you a weekend filled with unlimited fun — Games, movie night, dance party, stunning sunset views, jacuzzi sessions, and cozy dome stays.

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: Dolce Far Niente
description: Indulge in a thoughtfully curated 5-course vegetarian tasting menu by Chef Sibin, where each dish is mindfully paired with wine by Ms. Ganga Ghale. Designed for a slow, leisurely Sunday afternoon, this one-time experience invites you to sink into the art of unhurried dining and celebrate the beauty of doing nothing at all.

name: The Garden Social with DOORS
description: About the EventThe Garden Social, in collaboration with Courtyard and DOORS, is an open-air social evening filled with conversation, curiosity, and a little bit of play.We invite you to slow down for an afternoon of screen-free connection - surrounded by trees, thoughtful questions, and friendly faces. Together, we’ll explore DOORS, a one-of-a-kind social card game designed to spark real conversations and meaningful moments.Whether you're showing up solo or with friends, this is your space to listen, reflect, laugh, and share.Limited spots available at ₹700 (Excluding taxes).The DeetsDate: Saturday, July 5thTime: 3PM – 5PMAt the Yard!Terms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: THE BREWHAUS
description: The BrewHaus Chapters:  Kling Brewery and BrezelHaus are teaming up for a one-of-a-kind session that digs into something old-school and brilliant—Germany’s sacred pairing of beer and bread.This isn't just another tasting. You’ll start with a guided beer and pretzel pairing session—five signature Kling brews, each matched with a different kind of handmade BrezelHaus pretzel. You’ll taste, learn, and actually understand why this combo has held strong for centuries.Then it gets hands-on. We’re running a pretzel-folding workshop where you get to twist your own like they do in the back kitchens of Bavaria.Wrap it up with two full pints of any Kling beer—your call. No frills. No boring beer stories. Just real flavour, craft, and culture.Only 20 seats. One evening. No second rounds. If you know, you’ll book. If you don’t, you’ll scroll past it and regret it later.

location.address: 27, Ground Floor, Sattva Auro, Church St, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India
